attributes.action: Increase funding for counselling for 11-18 year olds in education in Bucks.
attributes.additional_details: Holmer Green Senior School offered but never provided counselling for two students (sisters) who had lost their father at a young age and was receiving no support outside of school. This resulted in one of the sisters suffering from depression and the other having terrible anxiety.
attributes.background: There is a lack of funding for counselling for those in secondary education, resulting in some schools being unable to afford a counsellor to help their students who are unable to access help outside of school. Therefore there should be more funding allocated to secondary schools for pastoral care.

rejection.details:
The issue you raise is not the responsibility of the UK Government or Parliament. Counselling services in Buckinghamshire schools are the responsibility of local education authorities. 

You could start a new petition asking for the Government to increase funding for counselling services in all schools in England.
